trans-unit.source:
Manages TYPO3 extensions from a central repository, which includes plugins, modules, class extensions, configuration code etc.
Access for 'admin' users only!
System extension (typo3/sysext/) - Always distributed with the TYPO3 source code (static).
Global extension (typo3/ext/) - Available for shared source on server (dynamic).
Local extension (typo3conf/ext/) - Local for this TYPO3 installation only (dynamic).
When you interact with the online repository, server information may be sent and stored in the repository for statistics.
Did you find a security problem?

Please be aware that extensions are third-party software. Installing an extension is a security risk, as the high level of quality and security in the TYPO3 Core can not be assured in these extensions.
If you think you have found a security issue in TYPO3 or an extension, please contact the %sTYPO3 security team%s! Thank you!
If you want to use an extension in TYPO3, you should simply click the "plus" button %s .
Installed extensions can also be removed again - just click the remove button %s .
Update the extension in '%s' from online repository to server
The extension is excluded from updates! You can change this in the appropriate ext_emconf.php file.
Import this extension from online repository to the 'local' directory typo3conf/ext/.
Extensions in TYPO3 Extension Repository (online) - Grouped by:
This is the list of extensions which are available locally, but not in the repository.
They might be user-defined and should be prepended user_ then.
Extensions found only on this server
Connect to the current mirror and retrieve the current list of available plugins from the TYPO3 Extension Repository.
Enable extensions without review (basic security check):
Make sure you know what consequences enabling this checkbox might have. Check the %sinformation on typo3.org about security reviews%s!
This is not your password to the TYPO3 backend! This user information is what is needed to log in at typo3.org with your account there!
Select a mirror from below. This list is built from the online mirror list retrieved from the URL above.
Click here to reload the list.
If you set a repository URL, this overrides the use of a mirror. Use this to select a specific (private) repository.

For the selected languages the EM tries to download and install translation files if available, whenever an extension is installed. (This replaces the csh_* extensions that were used to install core translations before TYPO3 version 4!)
To request an update or installation for already loaded extensions, see below.
This table shows the status of the translations of the loaded extensions.
This table shows the update results of the translations of the loaded extensions.
If you want to force a full check or update, delete the l10n zip-files from the typo3temp folder.
Possible reasons: Network problems, allow_url_fopen is off, cURL is not enabled in the Install Tool
This extension is excluded from updates! You can change this in the ext_emconf.php file in the extension folder.
Error: The list could not be fetched from %s.
The mirror list has been updated and now contains %s entries.
The mirror list was not updated as it contained no entries.
Error: The extension MD5 sum could not be fetched from %s.
The extensions list has been updated and now contains %s extension entries.
The extension list has not changed remotely, it has thus not been fetched.
Extension was already installed, it has been loaded.
Extension not available in matching version.
Extension has been imported from repository and loaded.
Extension is in repository, but could not be loaded.
A version of the extension was already present in '%s' and the overwrite flag was not set.
No extension key in file. Strange...
Wrong file format. No data recognized, %s.
No file uploaded! Probably the file was too large for PHPs internal limit for uploadable files.
Error: File '%s' could not be created!!!
Error: File '%s' MD5 was different from the md5 of the original file - so the file is corrupted!
Cache-files are removed and will be re-written upon next hit.
Error: The extension path '%s' was different than expected...
Error: The extension can only be installed in the path %s (lockType=%s).
Error: No extension key!!! Why? - nobody knows... (Or there are no files in the file array...)
Error: The data transfer did not succeed. %s
Error: Installation is not allowed in this path (%s).
Before the extension can be installed the database needs to be updated with new tables or fields.
Please select which operations to perform:
typo3conf/LocalConfiguration.php seems not to be writable, so the extension cannot be installed automatically!
Error while trying to download the extension file...
No changes to the file detected!
Saving failed, the content was not correctly written to disk. Changes have been lost!
[SAVING IS DISABLED - It can be enabled with the $TYPO3_CONF_VARS['EXT']['noEdit'] flag]
Files larger than %s KBytes are not allowed to be edited.
Fatal Edit error: File '%s' was not inside the correct path of the TYPO3 Extension!
The extension is installed (loaded and running)!
Click here to remove the extension:
Click here to install the extension:
This extension is entered in the TYPO3_CONF_VARS['EXT']['requiredExt'] list and is therefore always loaded.
(Notice: "Static data" may not need to be updated. You will only have to import static data each time you upgrade the extension.)
(Notice: You may need to clear the cache after the configuration of the extension. This is required if the extension adds TypoScript depending on these settings.)
The extensions has an extension key prefixed "user_" which indicates that it is a user-defined extension with no official unique identification. Therefore it cannot be uploaded.
You have not configured a default username/password yet. %sGo to "Settings"%s if you want to do that.
Dumping table content for static tables:
Write current static table contents to ext_tables_static+adt.sql now!
Write this dump to ext_tables.sql now!
This dump is based on two factors:
1) All tablenames in ext_tables.sql which are not found in the "modify_tables" list in ext_emconf.php are dumped with the current database structure.
2) For any tablenames which are listed in "modify_tables" all fields and keys found for the table in ext_tables.sql will be re-dumped with the fresh equivalents from the database.

Bottomline is: Whole tables are dumped from database with no regard to which fields and keys are defined in ext_tables.sql. But for tables which are only modified, any NEW fields added to the database must in some form or the other exist in the ext_tables.sql file as well.
This extension is currently installed (loaded and active) and so cannot be deleted!
You cannot delete (and install/update) extensions in the %s scope.
ERROR: Could not remove extension directory '%s'. The following errors occurred:
Are you sure you want to delete this extension from the server?
(Maybe you should make a backup first, see above.)
This extension is neither a global nor a local one and so cannot be removed.
Are you sure you want to update EM_CONF?

If files are changed, added or removed to an extension this is normally detected and displayed so you know that this extension has been altered locally and may need to be uploaded or at least not overwritten.
Updating this file will reset this check.
An unexpected error has occurred. There are problems with your extension key or with the extension data.
Probably one or more required fields/tables are missing in the database!
The static tables are missing or empty!
The database will need to be updated when this extension is installed.
All required tables are already in the database!
A difference between the originally installed version and the current one was detected!
A %s extension with this key is also available on the server, but cannot be loaded, because the "%s" version takes precedence.
Date of upload of the repository version.
Current version of the extension on this server. If printed bold, there is a newer version in the repository! Then you should upgrade.
Current type of installation of the extension on this server.
Number of downloads: all versions/this version
Import to both local and global path is disabled in TYPO3_CONF_VARS!
Configured TYPO3_MOD_PATH "%s" is different from "%s", which it should be.
No definition of MCONF[name] variable found inside!
Backend module conf file "%s" should exist, but does not!
Backend module folder "%s" should exist, but does not!
It seems like there is a backend module in "%s" which is not configured in ext_emconf.php.
Error: Upload folder "%s" did not exist!
Class filename "%s" contained the class "%s" just as it should.
Class filename "%s" did NOT contain the class "%s"!
Couldn't find the include_once statement for XCLASS!
The XCLASS filename-key "%s" was different from "%s" which it should have been!
No XCLASS filename-key found in file "%s". Maybe a regex coding error here...
No XCLASS inclusion code found in file "%s".
Error: "%s" was either not a file, or it was equal to the removed directory or simply outside the removed directory "%s"!
Error: "%s" could not be removed (are there files left?)
Error: Extension directory "%s" could not be removed (are there files or folders left?)
FATAL ERROR: Extension key was not set for some VERY strange reason. Nothing done...
ERROR: Could not remove extension directory "%s". Reasons:
ERROR: Could not create extension directory "%s"!
ERROR: The extension install path "%s" was no directory!
Notice: Module "%s" uses module-API to register module, TYPO3_MOD_PATH and $BACK_PATH not required.
Error: Either TYPO3_MOD_PATH or $BACK_PATH was not found in the "%s" file. You must manually configure that!
The file "%s" was updated with a cleaned up EM_CONF array.
Error: No file "%s" found. DON'T PANIC!
Error: The total size of the uncompressed upload (%s) exceeds %s!
Error: Extension path for extension "%s" not found!
The running PHP version (%s) is lower than required (%s).
The running PHP version (%s) is higher than allowed (%s).
The running TYPO3 version (%s) is lower than required (%s).
The running TYPO3 version (%s) is higher than allowed (%s).
The extension "%s" was not available in the system. Please import it from the TYPO3 Extension Repository.
Import this extension to the 'local' directory typo3conf/ext/ from online repository.
Extension "%s" (%s) was not installed. Please install it first.
The running version of extension "%s" (%s) is lower than required (%s).
The running version of extension "%s" (%s) is higher than allowed (%s).
The extensions "%s" and "%s" (%s) will conflict with each other. Please remove "%s", if you want to install "%s".
Extension "%s" was not available in the system. You may want to import it from the TYPO3 Extension Repository.
Extension "%s" (%s) was not installed. You may want to install it.
The extension(s) '%s' depend(s) on the extension you are trying to remove. The operation was not completed.
This extension requests the cache to be cleared when it is installed/removed.
The extension requires the upload folder '%s' to exist.
ERROR: The path '%s' could not be created.
The extension requires the folder '%s' to exist.
This extension provides additional configuration options which become available once it is installed.
Fatal error: Table for dump not found in database...
The extension is now available in version %s.
Include not loaded extensions into listing
Display the list of changed files
There are new versions of the following extensions in the TER
A difference between the originally installed version and the current was detected!
Last update of the list of extensions:
Last update of the list of extensions: %s.
To get and update the list, go to the section "Import extensions" and use the button "Retrieve/Update".
To get and update the list, %sgo to the section "Import extensions" and use the button "Retrieve/Update"%s.
